projects.name: AMAALA Construction Village
projects.description: Design and build contract for a workforce accommodation complex supporting the AMAALA luxury destination. The contract covers civil and infrastructure works for three stages, each accommodating 5,184 residents, with total capacity of 15,552. Facilities will include community amenities and utilize off‑site fabrication and modular construction to reduce environmental impact and delivery time.
highlights: KSA-based TAFGA firm selected for its understanding of the local landscape and ability to create short‑ and long‑term residential communities.
Sustainable design employing off‑site fabrication and modular construction techniques to minimize environmental impact and reduce delivery time.
Each stage addresses the needs of 5,184 future residents; upon completion the village will accommodate 15,552 residents and include community facilities for staff.
sources: worldconstructiontoday.com article detailing AMAALA contract award and project scope

projects.name: Planon Facility Services Business Solution Implementation
projects.description: Planon signed a contract with Tamimi Global on 25 November 2024 to implement its Facility Services Business Solution (FSBS), part of the Planon Field Services Platform. The implementation will support TAFGA’s field services operations—including hard and soft facility management and space/real estate services—streamline processes, optimize resource allocation, enhance customer satisfaction and reduce costs.
highlights: TAFGA employs over 17,000 employees and offers services across operations & maintenance, temporary facility construction, facility management, catering, industrial services and executive management.
Planon FSBS will provide a Total Experience solution, helping Tamimi deliver improved customer and employee satisfaction.
Virtual IT, Planon’s certified partner in the Middle East, will assist with deployment.
sources: Planon press release on Planon contracts with Tamimi Global

projects.name: NEOM Construction Village (contract with SATCO)
projects.description: Tamimi Group and Saudi Arabian Trading & Construction Co. (SATCO) were awarded a contract to build and operate a construction village for the NEOM megacity project, providing accommodation for 30,000 workers. The project supports NEOM’s 500 billion USD mega‑city development.
highlights: Designed to accommodate 30,000 workers supporting the NEOM development.
Part of NEOM’s futuristic giga‑project under Saudi Vision 2030.
sources: Construction Week Saudi article on Tamimi Global as a top KSA construction firm

projects.name: Aramco Camp Operations – Jazan City
projects.description: Under an agreement with Saudi Aramco, Tamimi Global operates and maintains the Aramco camp in Jazan City for Primary and Downstream Industries. The camp’s power supply is provided by twelve CAT 3516 units delivering 10 MW; Tamimi is responsible for their operation and maintenance.
highlights: Zahid Tractor overhauled several CAT 3516 units used to supply power to the camp.
Tamimi operates and maintains the camp’s power generation units.
sources: Zahid Group article on Aramco camp operations agreement

entries.description: Tamimi Global paid USD 13 million to resolve U.S. criminal and civil allegations related to kickbacks and illegal gratuities involving subcontracts under the U.S. Army’s LOGCAP III programme. The settlement, which included a deferred prosecution agreement and civil payment, resolved allegations that TAFGA paid bribes to obtain subcontracts to provide services to U.S. military forces in the Middle East.
